terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: University of Cambridge, Division of Virology, Department of Pathology.

description: SILAC-labelling analysis of murine BV-2 cells infected at high multiplicity of infection (10 TCID50/cell) and harvested at 4h or 9h post-infection. Lysates were then suject to m7GTP-sepharose affinity purification to enrich for translation initiation factors. As norovirus translation uses a VPg protein covalently linked to the 5' of its RNAs for initiation factor recruitment it was hypothesised that norovirus infection could modify initiation factor complexes. A paired dataset investigates the effects of MNV infection on total protein levels in infected cells. This dataset is a Maxquant reanalysis of data previously submitted under PXD004019

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: SILAC, m7GTP, translation, initiation, norovirus, MNV

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Emmott E, Sorgeloos F, Caddy SL, Vashist S, Sosnovtsev S, Lloyd R, Heesom K, Locker N, Goodfellow I. Norovirus-mediated modification of the translational landscape via virus and host-induced cleavage of translation initiation factors. Mol Cell Proteomics. 2017 Jan 13. pii: mcp.M116.062448

title: AP-MS analysis of m7GTP-binding proteins in Murine norovirus infected BV-2 cells (v2)
